I have instructed the relevant parties to commence the review of the Privatization Act with a view to repealing it and replacing it with a more facilitate framework that will accelerate privatizations.

We will embark on privatisation of public corporations a way to generate wealth. We intend to get between 5-10 mature public sectors companies listing at NSE in 12 months. @WilliamsRuto  #NSEMarketPlace  https://t.co/cy9vgk1xRh

The FiRe Award 2022 is officially live and welcomes submissions from all companies interested ahead of the 2022 ceremony in December.  #shapinginvestmentconversations  https://t.co/HufNqF8zeO
Such alignment with reporting excellence is critical in positioning Kenya as an investment hub for both local and foreign investors ~ FCPA Wycliffe Shammiah CEO @CMAKenya
The sustainable standards of reporting have ceased to be nice to have and transitioned into essential to have with impact investing being a key consideration now.  https://t.co/g3btrfpQwN

The adoption of the standards promoted by the @FiReAwardEA that include non- financial information ensure a seamless value chain in information reporting hence providing better clarity for stakeholders ~ Mr. Fred Riaga CEO @PSASBKe  https://t.co/0UGKa2VRgl

Public sector reporting and disclosure in alignment with internationally recognised standards creates financial prudence and increases the value of information in the public sector~ FCPA Fred Riaga CEO @PSASBKe  https://t.co/A3m9kZyqrK

It is commendable to see companies both in the public sector and private sector align themselves with international standards in reporting conforming as well with the sustainability agenda ~ CPA Edwin Makori CEO @ICPAK_Kenya @CeoIcpak  https://t.co/wigolARA9e

Investors now want more information in the evaluation of a company to get a greater picture of a company's performance. The FiRe awards have to this end created a robust rich reporting environment for all stakeholders ~ CPA Edwin Makori @CeoIcpak CEO @ICPAK_Kenya  https://t.co/4cLS9iwKZj

We look forward to receiving entries from as many companies as are interested for purposes of evaluation ahead of the award ceremony in December. It is not only an opportunity to win but an opportunity to learn~Mr. @g_odundo @NSE_PLC CE and FiRe Awards Executive Committee Chair.

It is important for companies to incorporate both financial and non financial components of reporting to accelarate performance and create better value addition for shareholders~ @NSE_PLC CE Mr @g_odundo  https://t.co/FyDGl7UCTF

The benefits of holistic reporting cannot be gainsaid. Excellence in  reporting allows for better recognition of opportunity and risk and overall, better performance for companies ~ @NSE_PLC CE Mr. @g_odundo  https://t.co/RCcHWjSL9X

The FiRe awards have over the years endeavoured to recognize reporting excellence in both public and private sector companies driving up compliance to global standards of reporting ~ @NSE_PLC CE and @FiReAwardEA Executive Committee Chairman Mr. @g_odundo  https://t.co/yl1TwCcuJE

Trading Members include brokers and investment banks. They have rights to trade on their own account as well as on account of their clients, but have no right to clear and settle such trades themselves. They are the go-between for clients and clearing members. #InvestInYourNEXT

Clearing House acts as a buyer to every seller & seller to every buyer through novation. It doesn't trade with investors; clearing members share responsibility for the liquidity of the clearing action. They are banks or financial institutions licensed by CBK. #InvestInYourNEXT

Investors buy or sell derivatives to manage the risk associated with the underlying security, to protect against fluctuations in value, or to profit from market movements. Here is an example to help you understand #derivatives. #InvestInYouNEXT  https://t.co/EGP54GsAC1

The derivative itself is merely a contract between two or more parties. Investors buy or sell derivatives to manage the risk associated with the underlying security, to protect against fluctuations in value, or to profit from market movements. #InvestInYourNEXT
There are 4 types of derivate instruments futures, forwards, swaps & options. NSE specialises in #Futures Contracts. #InvestInYouNEXT  https://t.co/lO5XIjTlnL

Derivatives are traded in two types of markets: over the counter (OTC) & on an exchange. In an OTC parties trade directly with each other on their terms without going through an intermediary while on an exchange trading is standardised & prices transparent. #InvestInYourNEXT

A derivative is a financial instrument whose characteristics and value depend on an underlying asset. The asset can be an equity, currency, bond, interest rate, commodity or even the weather. #InvestInYourNEXT

Fixed Rate Note:Bond with a fixed interest rate.i.e Housing Finance bond to carry a coupon  rate of 8.50%
FloatingRateNote:Bond with variable interest rate.Tied to certain money market index.i.e Housing Finance price pegged @ 3%above 182dayT-Bill
Medium term note:A bond whose maturity period takes 5 to 10 years.Allows a company to tailor its debt issuance to meet its financial needs
